channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

  • City: GOODYEAR

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED CALL ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE IR4 BELT LINE. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE WITH FULL PPE AND FOLLOWED APPROPRIATE STEPS TO SAFELY AND PROPERLY CONTAINT THE HAZMAT. ONCE INSIDE THE LINED SPILL TRAY, THEY BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE PSC FOR PROPER DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report E-2024100389
item.description:
Report E-2024100389

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 7, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of Zep Morado Super Cleaner were crushed and released approximately one and a half (1.5) cups of product to the dock floor and cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Zep Morado Super Cleaner-impacted dock floor and cardboard and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and four (4) 5-gallon pails of Zep Morado Super Cleaner were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100090
item.description:
Report I-2024100090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AFTER YESTERDAYS ENCOUNTER WITH THESE SHIPPERS, WE DECIDED WHEN THEY RETENDERED WE CONDUCTED A PHYSCAL SEARCH ON EVERY BOX BROUGHT IN WHEN SEARCHING AWB 001-93870803 WE FOUND SEVERAL PERFUMES A TATTOO GUN, AND A HOVER BOARD. THE TATTOO GUN CONTAINED LITHIUM BATTERIES AS WELL AS THE HOVER BOARD. UPON SEEING THIS WE REFUSED THE SHPMENT. THE HOVER BOARD & TATTOO GUN WAS WRAPPED IN PLASTC THEN PLACED NTO THE BOXES.
